body: Hi Grasshope, You can use a denser sky but I doubt that will change anything as based on the weather data there is no direct radiation at 8 am. That's why you get a fully diffused sky. Here are the data from the weather file for 8 am and 9 am. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MhqovnvrwKrr-AoG3TBUtLo8MflsXOGyNE3PSDh5sDK7*LvqX*hqxrgkSfVDBdPhKFTL2FqBu4iNBp7MuQJ0rxRxS9iofSdz/8_am_diffuse.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/MhqovnvrwKpQfSL-7mcX7OMWQ-iujZilFxg6G-RYzs0iH2EQPQgaDUZO6-sDrRmTi8MI06Sa0uBW88tnc1rwsbL16u3sfj7m/9_am_direct.png)
